events.message: The claimant reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection on April 30th.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident following review of the initial report and accident details provided.
An auto claims agent specialized in vehicle collision cases was assigned to manage and investigate the claim promptly.
The claimant received prompt confirmation that their car accident claim has been acknowledged and is under review.
The claimant was asked to submit police reports, vehicle damage photos, and a copy of their driving license for further processing.
All requested documents including police report and photos of the damaged vehicle were submitted by the claimant on time.
The investigation into the car collision was initiated with an independent adjuster assigned to assess liability and damages.
The investigation confirmed fault and estimated repair costs to the claimant’s car based on adjuster's assessment.
A settlement offer covering the vehicle repair costs and other damages was proposed to the claimant for review.
The claimant responded expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and willingness to proceed with it.
The claim was formally approved after the claimant accepted the proposed settlement amount for their auto accident.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the claimant’s preferred bank account to cover repair expenses.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following payment disbursement and confirmation of receipt by the claimant.
The completed claim file was archived in the records system for future reference and compliance purposes.
